instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no image on the screen,

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD_UF</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>GPUVCORE_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> 0.9v
<SIGNAL>PM_ALL_GPU_PGOOD</SIGNAL> 0v
no image on the external video, I think it is a d GPU.
I was thinking N13P-GT-Z-A2 don't die...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
That GPU is 8 yo.
You cannot expect to last an human life; some people die before even...

If GPU VCORE is OK, its power good should be high; check why not, in your case.
